{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3340854,"name":"","username":"Soren_1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soren_1/{size}/262420_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-22T18:35:34.249Z","cooked":"

In CTRE’s Swerve library docs, it doesn’t say anything about adding gyro measurements or any variable for the pigeon position/orientation on the robot, which leads me to think that it doesn’t take into account the actual movement of the gyro other than the yaw measurement.
Is there a way to add an IMU measurement to the pose estimator to make it more accurate?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-22T18:40:48.605Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":73.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459734,"topic_slug":"does-ctre-pose-estimation-include-the-inertial-measurement-from-the-gyro-or-just-rotation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Onshape enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/does-ctre-pose-estimation-include-the-inertial-measurement-from-the-gyro-or-just-rotation/459734/1","custom_user_title":"Onshape enjoyer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3340868,"name":"amber","username":"amb","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e36b37/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-22T18:53:45.326Z","cooked":"

My team has tried fusing gyroscope accelerometer measurements with odometry in the past. Short answer is double integration is very noisy and error can accumulate quickly over longer timescales. What ended up being used was checking if there was a large discrepancy between wheel readings and integrated acceleration readings and switching to the gyroscope temporarily if there was for a few seconds.

Probably too complicated for how few and far between the benefits are, though.
